extendedIngredients.name: active yeast
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 packages (1/4 ounce each) active dry yeast

recipes.title: Butter Nut Twists
recipes.instructions: Directions                                                                                In a small bowl, dissolve yeast in warm water. In a large bowl, mix the flour, sugar and salt. Cut in butter until crumbly. Add the buttermilk, eggs and yeast mixture; stir to form a soft dough. Cover with plastic wrap; refrigerate overnight.                                                                                           In another bowl, mix the filling ingredients. Punch down dough; divide into three portions. On a sugared surface, roll one portion into a 12-in. x 9-in. rectangle. Sprinkle 1/3 cup filling lengthwise down one half of the dough. Fold dough in half over filling, forming a 12-in. x 4-1/2 -in. rectangle; pat down to press filling into dough. Seal edges.                                                                                           Sprinkle an additional 1/3 cup filling down one half of the folded dough. Fold in half again, forming a 12-in. x 2-1/4-in. rectangle. Press to form a 12-in. x 4-in. rectangle. Cut into twenty-four 1/2-in. slices. Repeat with remaining dough and additional filling. Twist each slice one time and roll in remaining filling; place 2 in. apart on greased baking sheets.                                                                                           Bake at 350° for 15-18 minutes or until golden brown. Remove from pans to wire racks; serve warm or at room temperature.                                        Yield: 6 dozen.                                                                                                                         Originally published as Butter Nut Twists in  Taste of HomeDecember/January 1994, p27                                                                                                                                                                                                        Nutritional Facts                                                                             1 roll equals 105 calories, 7 g fat (3 g saturated fat), 16 mg cholesterol, 63 mg sodium, 10 g carbohydrate, 1 g fiber, 2 g protein.                                                                                                                                                                     Print                                                                                    Add to Recipe Box                            Email a Friend

steps.step: In a small bowl, dissolve yeast in warm water. In a large bowl, mix the flour, sugar and salt.
Add the buttermilk, eggs and yeast mixture; stir to form a soft dough. Cover with plastic wrap; refrigerate overnight.

In another bowl, mix the filling ingredients. Punch down dough; divide into three portions. On a sugared surface, roll one portion into a 12-in. x 9-in. rectangle. Sprinkle 1/3 cup filling lengthwise down one half of the dough. Fold dough in half over filling, forming a 12-in. x 4-1/2 -in. rectangle; pat down to press filling into dough. Seal edges.
Sprinkle an additional 1/3 cup filling down one half of the folded dough. Fold in half again, forming a 12-in. x 2-1/4-in. rectangle. Press to form a 12-in. x 4-in. rectangle.
Cut into twenty-four 1/2-in. slices. Repeat with remaining dough and additional filling. Twist each slice one time and roll in remaining filling; place 2 in. apart on greased baking sheets.
Bake at 350° for 15-18 minutes or until golden brown.
Remove from pans to wire racks; serve warm or at room temperature.
